results.title: Learning from Japanese Model of Development
results.summary: This article examines Japan's post-WWII economic recovery and suggests lessons for Pakistan, focusing on industrialization, technology indigenization, education, and governance. It highlights Japan's economic miracle despite nuclear devastation and its focus on education and technology. No scripture is referenced.

results.title: Trump's AI Action Plan Pivots from Guardrails to Green Lights
results.summary: An article from the Peterson Institute for International Economics (PIIE) discusses Donald Trump's AI Action Plan. The plan aims to accelerate AI development in the US while relaxing regulations, contrasting with the previous administration's cautious approach. It addresses workforce, infrastructure, and export controls, but lacks focus on immigration. The plan favors diffusion of US technologies, even if it benefits China, and supports open AI model development, aligning with OpenAI's recent shift. The article highlights the debate over balancing AI export benefits with risks of diversion to China, and the challenges of coordinating with allies due to inconsistent policies. "The Trump administrationâ€™s call for multilateral adoption of US controls is positive because the US cannot impose effective controls alone."
